items.title: Fix /reviews Page Title & Meta
items.description: The /reviews page has 0% CTR on 95 impressions despite amazing interactive features. Current title 'Best Hangover Prevention Pills 2025' doesn't match user query 'best dhm supplement'. Need to align title with actual search intent and add Top 3 Picks box at page top.
items.current_state: Title: 'Best Hangover Prevention Pills 2025', CTR: 0%, Impressions: 95
changes_required: Change title to: 'Best DHM Supplements 2025: Top 7 Tested & Ranked'
Add 'Winner's Podium' at top with 'Best Overall', 'Best Budget', 'Best for Hangovers'
Keep interactive widget (great UX, just not the lead)
items.why_important: 0% CTR on 95 impressions is inexcusable for a well-built page. The gap between 'hangover pills' and 'dhm supplement' is killing visibility.
acceptance_criteria: Title changed in both meta tags and prerendered HTML
Top 3 Picks box visible above interactive widget
Submitted to Google Search Console for reindexing
CTR tracked for 2-4 weeks to measure improvement
items.risk: LOW - Pure optimization, no code changes to widget

items.title: Fix /research Page Title & Meta
items.description: 882 impressions with 0% CTR at position 7.4. Current generic title 'DHM Clinical Studies & Research' doesn't create urgency or promise specific value. Need specific, benefit-driven title that highlights the 23 studies analyzed and the 87% effectiveness rate.
items.current_state: Title: 'DHM Clinical Studies & Research', CTR: 0%, Impressions: 882, Position: 7.4
changes_required: Change title to: 'Does DHM Really Work? What 23 Studies Found (87% Effective)'
Update meta description to highlight key findings
Add structured data for Research/MedicalStudy if not present
items.why_important: 882 impressions with 0 clicks is massive wasted opportunity. Page already ranks well (position 7.4), just needs compelling title.
acceptance_criteria: Title updated in meta tags and prerendered HTML
Meta description includes '23 studies' and '87% effective'
items.risk: LOW - Title/meta only, no content changes

items.title: Fix RCT Clinical Trials Page
items.description: 821 impressions with 0% CTR at position 7.2. Generic title doesn't communicate value proposition. Need to highlight the 5 specific studies and recent date range (2024-2025) to establish freshness and credibility.
changes_required: Change title to: 'DHM Clinical Trials: 5 Studies Prove It Works (2024-2025)'
Update meta description with key trial outcomes
Ensure page includes actual data from the 5 studies mentioned
items.why_important: 800+ impressions = strong visibility, but 0% CTR means title isn't converting. Quick win with high ROI.
acceptance_criteria: Title includes '5 Studies' and date range '2024-2025'
Page content actually covers 5 distinct trials
items.risk: LOW - If page doesn't have 5 studies, may need content audit first

items.title: Fix Flyby Review Page
items.description: 777 impressions with only 0.13% CTR at position 6.8. Title doesn't include social proof (7,200+ user reviews) or create value proposition clarity. Need to highlight user count, rating, and price-per-dose to help users make decision.
changes_required: Change title to: 'Flyby Recovery: 7,200+ Users Rate 4.3 Stars - Worth $3/Dose?'
Meta description should include key pros/cons
Ensure review includes actual user rating data
items.why_important: Huge social proof (7,200 users) not leveraged in title. Position 6.8 with 777 impressions means strong ranking, just need better CTR.
acceptance_criteria: Page content validates the user count and rating claims
items.risk: LOW - Verify actual user count and rating before using in title

items.title: Fix 'When to Take DHM' Page
items.description: 316 impressions with 1.27% CTR at position 9.7. Already ranking but position suggests room for improvement. Needs better title/meta to increase CTR and signal relevance to Google for position boost.
changes_required: Optimize title to be more specific and actionable
Meta description should promise direct answer
Consider adding 'Ultimate Guide' or year to title
items.why_important: Low-hanging fruit - already ranking on page 1, small CTR boost will compound with position improvement.
acceptance_criteria: Title more specific than generic 'When to Take DHM'
Track both CTR and position changes
items.risk: LOW - Already has some CTR, just needs optimization

items.title: Submit Updated Pages to GSC & Set Up Tracking
items.description: After updating the 5 pages above, need to submit all to Google Search Console for reindexing and set up weekly tracking to measure CTR improvements over baseline.
items.current_state: No systematic tracking of CTR changes
changes_required: Submit all 5 updated URLs to GSC for reindexing
Set up weekly GSC report to track CTR changes
Document baseline metrics (current CTR, impressions, position)
Create tracking spreadsheet for 2-4 week monitoring
items.why_important: Without tracking, can't validate strategy or make data-driven decisions. Critical for proving ROI.
acceptance_criteria: All 5 URLs submitted via GSC URL Inspection tool
Weekly GSC export scheduled or automated
Baseline spreadsheet created with current metrics
Alert set up for CTR changes >20%

items.title: Start E-E-A-T Foundation
items.description: Health content requires strong E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness) signals. Need author bio, About Us page, and medical reviewer to protect against algorithm updates that target low-credibility health sites.
changes_required: Write author bio with relevant credentials/experience
Create job post for medical reviewer (MD, PharmD, RD) on Upwork
Draft 'About Us' page with transparency about mission and qualifications
Prepare citation style guide for all clinical claims
items.expected_impact: Risk mitigation - prevents catastrophic traffic loss
items.why_important: E-E-A-T is insurance policy against Google algorithm updates. One health algorithm update could wipe out 100% of traffic without this.
acceptance_criteria: Author bio published on site with credentials
Upwork job post created with clear requirements
About Us page drafted (ready for review)
items.risk: MEDIUM - Will need to vet medical reviewer credentials carefully

items.title: Create DHM Timing Guide (Utility Guide #1)
items.description: Build first new Utility Guide following proven dosage guide template. 'When to take DHM' queries show high CTR (1.27% even at position 9.7). Create comprehensive guide answering: before/after drinking, how far in advance, with food or without, morning-after timing, etc.
items.format: Utility Guide (same structure as dosage guide)
structure: Direct answer in first 4 lines with emojis
items.why_important: Grok flagged 'when to take' queries get high CTR. Gemini confirmed it solves specific user problem. Follows proven Utility Guide formula.
acceptance_criteria: Clinical citations for all timing claims
dependencies: Complete E-E-A-T setup first for credibility

items.title: Create DHM Stack Guide (Utility Guide #2)
items.description: Build second Utility Guide on 'What to combine with DHM for maximum effect'. Natural cross-sell opportunity with high commercial intent. Cover DHM + NAC, DHM + Milk Thistle, DHM + B-Vitamins, DHM + Electrolytes, etc.
structure: Direct answer: Top 3 stacks with emojis
items.why_important: High commercial intent - users ready to buy. Natural cross-sell opportunity. Follows Utility Guide formula.
acceptance_criteria: Internal links to relevant product reviews
items.risk: MEDIUM - Need to verify supplement interaction safety with medical reviewer
dependencies: Medical reviewer hired and available for consultation

items.title: Create 'DHM vs NAC' Comparison
items.description: First priority comparison. NAC comparison already gets 4.65% CTR (validated demand). Cover effectiveness comparison, mechanism of action, safety profile, cost comparison, which to choose when.
structure: Direct answer: DHM vs NAC winner by use case
items.why_important: NAC comparison already shows 4.65% CTR - validated demand. Natural competitor to DHM.
acceptance_criteria: Internal links to DHM and NAC product reviews

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Activated Charcoal' Comparison
items.description: Myth-busting comparison. Activated charcoal is popular but scientifically questionable for hangovers. Opportunity to establish authority by debunking myths while positioning DHM as evidence-based alternative.
structure: Scientific explanation of why charcoal doesn't work
items.why_important: Myth-busting angle creates shareability. Positions site as evidence-based authority.
items.risk: LOW - Clear scientific consensus against charcoal for hangovers

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Electrolytes' Comparison
items.description: Compare DHM to popular electrolyte products (Pedialyte, Liquid IV). Address common misconception that electrolytes prevent hangovers vs only treating dehydration symptoms.
structure: Direct answer: Different purposes, complementary not competitive
Product recommendations for electrolytes + DHM stacks
items.why_important: Pedialyte/Liquid IV are mainstream competitors. Opportunity for cross-sell recommendation.
acceptance_criteria: Product links to both DHM and electrolyte products

items.title: Create DHM Safety Guide (Utility Guide #3)
items.description: Comprehensive safety guide covering side effects, risks by dosage, drug interactions, contraindications, who should avoid DHM. Critical for E-E-A-T and addressing safety concerns that prevent conversions.
structure: Direct answer: Safety verdict with caveats
items.why_important: Addresses purchase objections. Critical for E-E-A-T. Searches like 'is DHM safe' have high intent.
acceptance_criteria: Direct safety verdict in first 100 words
Safety table with dose-based risk levels
items.risk: HIGH - Medical/legal sensitivity, requires expert review

items.title: Hire & Onboard Medical Reviewer
items.description: Find and hire qualified medical professional (MD, PharmD, or RD) on Upwork to review all health-related content for E-E-A-T compliance. One-time setup plus ongoing review relationship.
deliverables: Review all existing cornerstone content
Add 'Medically Reviewed by Dr. [Name], MD' to key pages
Create review process for new content
Provide credentials for author bio
items.budget: $200-500 one-time setup + $50-100 per new guide review
items.why_important: Non-negotiable for health content. Insurance against Google algorithm updates targeting low-credibility sites.
acceptance_criteria: Reviewer has verifiable MD, PharmD, or RD credentials
Added 'Medically Reviewed' byline to reviewed pages
Established ongoing review process and pricing
Credentials visible on site About page
items.risk: MEDIUM - Need to vet credentials carefully

items.title: Create About Us & Author Pages
items.description: Build transparent About Us page explaining site mission, methodology, and credentials. Create author bio page with relevant experience and qualifications. Critical E-E-A-T signals.
deliverables: About Us page with mission statement
Methodology explanation (how products tested/reviewed)
Author bio with credentials and experience
Editorial standards and medical review process
Contact information
items.why_important: Google evaluates site-wide E-E-A-T. Missing About/Author pages hurt credibility across all content.
acceptance_criteria: Clear explanation of content creation process

items.title: Create Alcohol & Sleep Guide (Utility Guide #4)
items.description: How to protect REM sleep when drinking. Unique angle not well-covered by competitors. DHM's mechanism includes sleep protection, strong differentiator.

items.title: Create Hangover Symptom-Solver Guide (Utility Guide #5)
items.description: Interactive guide matching supplements to specific symptoms (nausea → ginger, headache → electrolytes, liver → DHM, etc.). Decision-making utility format.

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Vitamin B Complex' Comparison
items.description: B vitamins are commonly recommended for hangovers. Compare mechanisms, effectiveness, use cases. Natural extension comparison.

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Glutathione' Comparison
items.description: Glutathione is DHM's downstream product. Compare direct supplementation vs precursor (DHM). Technical but high-value audience.

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Ginger' Comparison
items.description: Ginger for nausea is popular remedy. Compare DHM's comprehensive approach vs ginger's symptom-specific relief.

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Prickly Pear' Comparison
items.description: Prickly pear has some clinical evidence for hangovers. Scientific comparison of evidence quality and mechanisms.

items.title: Create 'DHM vs L-Cysteine' Comparison
items.description: L-Cysteine is common in hangover supplements. Compare to DHM's mechanism. Lower volume but high intent.

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Turmeric' Comparison
items.description: Turmeric/curcumin for inflammation and liver health. Compare to DHM's specific hangover mechanism.

items.title: Create 'DHM vs Magnesium' Comparison
items.description: Magnesium for muscle recovery and headaches. Compare complementary benefits vs competitive positioning.

items.title: Optimize Existing Content Based on Data
items.description: After 6 months of new content, revisit all published guides and comparisons. Update based on GSC data: which FAQs to add, which CTAs perform best, which internal links drive engagement.
deliverables: GSC analysis of all published content
Add FAQs based on actual search queries
Update CTAs based on conversion data
Refresh citations with newer studies
Update 'Last Updated' dates
items.why_important: Data-driven optimization compounds gains. New search queries emerge, old content needs refreshing.

items.title: Build Internal Linking Strategy & Hub Architecture
items.description: Create topic cluster hub architecture to prevent content cannibalization and strengthen topical authority. DHM Guide (hub) → Timing Guide, Safety Guide, Stack Guide, etc. (spokes).
deliverables: Topic cluster map (hub and spoke pages)
Internal linking audit
Add contextual internal links to all content
Create pillar page if needed
Update navigation to reflect clusters
items.why_important: Prevents cannibalization. Signals topical authority to Google. Improves user journey and session duration.

items.title: A/B Test Title Variations
items.description: For underperforming pages (CTR <3%), create 2 title variations and test for 30 days. Use GSC data to determine winner, then scale pattern to other pages.
process: Identify 5 pages with CTR <3% but high impressions
items.why_important: Mitigates risk of CTR fixes not working. Builds knowledge of what titles work for your audience.

items.title: Scale to 10x: Final Push
items.description: Months 10-12: Create remaining comparisons (6-8 more) and optimize all content to hit 1,740 clicks/month (10x from baseline 174). Focus on highest ROI topics based on data from first 9 months.
deliverables: 6-8 additional comparison posts
Content refresh of all existing posts
Update all product recommendations
Add new FAQs based on GSC data
Expand thin content sections
items.why_important: Final push to 10x goal. By this point, have data on what works, can scale efficiently.

items.description: Review GSC data for CTR changes, new ranking opportunities, declining pages needing refresh
Full performance review against targets, adjust strategy based on what's working/not working
Submit each new utility guide for medical review before publication

risk_mitigation.risk: Algorithm update targets low E-E-A-T health sites
mitigation: Create About Us and Author pages
Add citations to all clinical claims
A/B test 2 title variations per page
Track for 30 days before concluding failure
Target long-tail variations (e.g., 'DHM dosage for women')
